pull.title: Minimal architectural changes necessary to support multiple wallets in bitcoin-qt
pull.body: This commit is a minimal restructuring necessary to support multiple wallets in the UI going forward. Please read https://github.com/CodeShark/bitcoin/blob/5bf2943a81e0937e4be0e8d2c6b4545b8d320cc4/multiwallet-qt.txt for details.

events.body: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/4af611676b784df41a9771792e828d62756c448d for binaries and test log.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/2184 already implements dynamic loading and unloading of wallets. But in the interest of incremental commits that are easier to verify, I decided to open this new pull request with the idea of having a discussion on the UI design and merging in these changes first before attempting to merge in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/2124 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/2184.
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5bf2943a81e0937e4be0e8d2c6b4545b8d320cc4 for binaries and test log.
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/ea02ca6e44b089ecdd5395d0255857a1023914e3 for binaries and test log.
Can you rebase this? Now that 0.8.0 final is out, I intend to test and merge it soon.
@CodeShark I still plan to merge this as one of the next things, can you rebase please?
Let me fix up some whitespace issues before you merge.

Allright, laanwj, it's all yours :)
Let me know if you need anything else.

events.message:
Minimal architectural changes necessary to support multiple wallets in bitcoin-qt
- This commit is a minimal restructuring necessary to support multiple wallets in the UI. Please see multiwallet-qt.txt for details.

events.body: The last rebase includes all current changes, i.e. the header and cpp cleanup pull? Then I'm fine with starting the evolution ^^.
Merged (manually due to slight #include conflict that I introduced by merging another pull)

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt: export broken after #2220
issue.body: I didn't look into this, but I noticed I can't use the GUI export function anymore after #2220 got merged. Has anyone observed the same?

issue.title: fix "send coins" via context menu in address book
issue.body:
- the send coins context menu entry was not working anymore, because
  a non current version of #2220 was merged onto current master
- also removes some unneeded spaces and adds a comment to
  WalletModel::getNumTransactions()

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt: debug window broken
issue.body: Seems #2220 also brokte the debug window, as `RPCConsole::setClientModel()` isn't called anymore anywhere.

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt: fix debug window
issue.body:
- fix debug window, by re-adding rpcConsole->setClientModel(clientModel);
  in BitcoinGUI::setClientModel(), which was removed by #2220

events.body: @CodeShark Is it intended that bitcoingui.cpp and walletview.cpp seem to have quite much duplicate code in them? It would also be nice, if you could take a look at #2436. I created pulls for some other stuff that was not working, but perhaps there is more. We need to be really careful with such pulls IMHO.

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt: fix opening verify message tab via main menu
issue.body: Another small bug that was introduced by #2220.

issue.title: gui: Refactor WalletFrame to extend QStackView
issue.body:
Some code added in #2220 no longer applies as the list of wallets is actually a combo in the toolbar.

Considering #16883, it's very unlikely the current GUI will change and follow the idea of #2220.
